metadata.name: Hexscape #120
metadata.description:
The hex is a place to play. 

This work draws on a number of inspirations. The hexagonal columnar formations that igneous rock can form. Places where rock conforms to nature's laws and unwittingly generates a pleasing landscape. And on the hex grids of the tabletop games that I used to spend hours pushing miniatures around on. This kind of landscape evokes, for me, possibilities for play and enjoyment, where it is always possible that something new and unexpected may be discovered. So I have created rules that I hope may generate something that inspires those feelings.

Features:
Hex Size: 20, 30, 50 or 70
Palette: Twenty one possible palettes.
Aspect Ratio: 1:1.2, 1:1.6, 1.6:1


The work will initially render with a short edge of 1000 pixels. 

Controls:
[1] Set shortest edge to 1000 pixels.
[2] Set shortest edge to 2000 pixels.
[3] Set shortest edge to 4000 pixels.
[s] Save at current resolution.


Made with javascript and p5.js. Simplex noise provided by OpenSimplexNoise.js.

metadata.name: Distorted Realities #1
metadata.description:
This evocative sketch embarks on a voyage through surreal landscapes, delving into realms where reality blurs and imagination takes flight. Through a fusion of intricate patterns and ethereal hues, this digital creation invites you to traverse the interplay of shifting forms and transient emotions.

Much like a conjured reverie, "Distorted Realities" is a collaborative dance between the artist's vision and the language of code, bringing forth the ineffable into tangible existence. These visuals not only stand as static images but also serve as a bridge between artistry, technology, and the profound exploration of the human psyche. Each stroke is a portal to the unshackled mind, a passage to boundless perception, and an entreaty to uncover the seldom-explored recesses of consciousness.

metadata.name: Sap song. Part II #108
metadata.description:
This artwork corresponds to the 2nd part of the ‚ÄòSap song‚Äô series. It seeks to expand the concept from new visual and sound variants.

Audiovisual generative artwork that continues with the proposal of excessive flows of organic forms. In time, frenetic arpeggios and populations of colorful plants with spiral flowers are emerging, all organized in their own way. And the sap again sings, feeds and shows us a constructive desire for afforestation.

The work has 3 moments:
I. ‚ÄúEnredo coral‚Äù
II. ‚ÄúRecitativo libre‚Äù
III. ‚ÄúCoda hacia la ra√≠z‚Äù

Original samplers of cello pizzicatos, marimba, music box, piano, and multiphonics of clarinet and flute.

[ s ] -> save 2160x2160px (in live view)
[ f ] -> fullscreen

attributes.name: instruments:
attributes.value: cello, marimba, music box and clarinet

metadata.name: The Main Path #108
metadata.description:
A focal point on "The Main Path" is an identifiable and distinct path that draws attention by being placed between other paths. It is usually a central visual element that attracts viewers' attention and draws them to the designated main path.
I experimented a little more creatively with this design to leave a lasting impression on those who encounter it. I want to invite viewers on a journey of exploration and introspection. Furthermore, I want to create a spark in the viewer's thinking and invite him to interpret it.
Its importance lies not only in its aesthetic appeal but also in its ability to provoke thought and inspire conversation among viewers.
Overall, "The Main Path" is a powerful expression of beauty, captivating audiences with its depth and ability to transcend boundaries.

Made by p5.js
s = save

metadata.name: n Forms #149
metadata.description:
Hand-scrawled documentation of abstract structures. A journal from another realm.

Press 's' to save an image while in full-screen mode.

If you want to increase the resolution of the saved image, add e.g. &size=2000 after the live/fullscreen view URL to render the canvas at that specific pixel width (default = browser sized). This will be dependent on your system specifications, but outputs of up to 8000px wide, or above, should be possible.

Usually loads best in Chrome

metadata.name: fxPottery #103
metadata.description:
Pottery stands as one of humanity's earliest and most enduring inventions, a testament to our innate desire to craft and create. This project explores the timeless art of pottery through the lens of interactive generative art. In this artwork powered by fxhash, virtual ceramics, shaped by diverse artistic hands, come to life and are shared with the world.

This interactive pottery sim was written from scratch using vanilla JS and webgl shaders. A range of parameters are included to control the final scene and image via the fx params interface.

This artwork is part of the fxhackathon 2023 where artists were challenged to create projects using the interactive fx(params) system.

Standalone Controls

Use mouse or touch to control view
1 - Toggle Edit Mode
2 - Toggle WASD Free Cam
3 - Toggle Frame
4 - Save HD Image

Credits

Code and Outputs are Copyright 2023 Frank Force
Hash without Sine - MIT License - Copyright (c)2014 David Hoskins
Thank you to Inigo Quilez for 3D rendering articles and demos

metadata.name: Thirteen-576 #103
metadata.description:
We believe we have created a generative art piece which has the potential to be beautiful, to occasionally surprise and delight. To occasionally quieten the mind. We hope you enjoy it. 

Thirteen colours.
576 subtly different variations available via keyboard interaction.

1, 2 & 3 will change visible colour layers.
Q/q will switch between square and non-square layouts and toggle the border patterns on and off.
W/w will cycle between 3 border options.
E/e will cycle between 8 background options - if the default is no background then click E/e twice to activate.
R/r will cycle between 4 central motif rotation options. 
Most of these key presses will activate a complete redraw which may take a second or two for the more detailed patterns.

metadata.name: Foggy Window #122
metadata.description:
"Foggy Window: Perceptions of reality" explores the concept of reality through the lens of a foggy window, drawing inspiration from Plato's allegory of the cave.

The patterns, colours and shapes that emerge challenge the boundaries of what we think we know and invites to ponder the mysteries that lie beyond the surface of our understanding.

______________________________________________

The collection is made in pure code with p5.js and using the excellent chroma.js library.

10% of primary sales are donated to institutions working towards improving biodiversity and environmental efforts.

Key commands:
1 = 1000 px x 1250 px
2 = 2000 px x 2500 px

....
9 = 9000 px x 11250 px

s = export to png using current resolution
______________________________
Copyright (c) 2023 WhiteKoala.
Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: High City, Low City #37
metadata.description:
There's a different kind of life happening just down the street. I'll meet you there.

Made with Javascript and a canvas. Noise provided by OpenSimplexNoise.js

Key Controls:
[1] Size 800px
[2] Size 1600px
[3] Size 3200px
[4] Size 6400px
[f] Fit size to window (default)

[s] Save png at current resolution


Copyright (c) 2023 Monty Bartlett
Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: Rising perspective #113
metadata.description:
A random number of sections in casual position will show similar rock pillar landscapes under a different perspective.

Press [s] to save as png.
Add a "size" parameter, between 500 and 4500, to the url (for example &size=3500) for generate the artwork at chosen resolution, after loading press [s] to save in current format.

25% of royalties will go to non-profit organizations that deal with environmental conservation through cryptoforcharity (https://www.cryptoforcharity.io/)

Generative artwork by Gandhiavelli, @gandhiavelli. Made with p5js in 2022.

metadata.name: Rotation Bug #110
metadata.description:
Rotation Bug is, in part, an exercise in artistic humility and accepting that an error in layer rotation produces a piece that is often more interesting and aesthetically pleasing than our original intention. 

Bugged is now default for 75% of outputs.

2% have an artist signature in the background pattern.

You can fix/unfix the bug by clicking 'b' on the keyboard.

'd' and 'l' will switch between dark and light backgrounds.

'r' will randomise the tilings.

'b', 'd' and 'l' will reset to original tilings but 'r' will cycle through the same patterns after reset.

metadata.name: dab #63
metadata.description:
To create an expressive design with bold colors and intricate details, I used small, quick strokes and changed directions to create texture and depth.
Whether abstract, contemporary, or traditional, They inspired me, and I often tried to create vibrant and visually striking compositions to create a sense of movement and energy in my work and to make it an appealing and captivating form of artistic expression.

Made by p5.js
s = save

metadata.name: Ephemeral #19
metadata.description: Here we only come to get to know each other; we are merely passing through this Earth.

metadata.name: Intrusive Thoughts (on a loop) #32
metadata.description:
The concept for Intrusive Thoughts was born in the second half of 2022 during a series of therapy sessions.  Genuary 2023 played an important role on getting rid of most of my annoying intrusive thoughts.  Intrusive Thoughts (on a loop) is the first of four releases on the same topic.

Some browsers will need to tap or click to activate sound.  Use arrow up and arrow down to zoom or click on top and bottom.

metadata.name: Chroma Ciphers #39
metadata.description:
A generative series using the most basic of building blocks accentuated with colors.

This is the second Ciphers generative token in a series of three.

metadata.name: Primordial #31
metadata.description:
Primordial is a study of abstract forms. The algorithm, written in p5.js and WebGL, utilizes domain warping to create twisted fields of color and then overlays thousands of tiny lines to provide depth and texture. The outputs are chaotic but not completely formless, like a swirling mass of plasma from the early universe, or a strange proto-life form suspended in prehistoric ooze.

CONTROLS:

1-9: Increase resolution and save image in PNG format

B: Toggle borders on/off

F: Fullscreen
P: Portrait
L: Landscape
S: Square

For third party license information, please see license.md

David Brice Allen
October 2022

metadata.name: Algorithm, be my guide #208
metadata.description:
At length, I summoned the courage to approach.

-

I was worn. Months of aimless wandering have culminated in this series; a meditation on my struggles to find a direction in my life and with my art.

At times paralyzed by too many possibilities, and at other times completely void of ideas. I was lost in the depths of my thinking, overwhelmed by indecision and doubt.

Generative works are a form of process art, yet along the way I‚Äôd forgotten to ‚Äútrust the process‚Äù. It was time to cede control and let each line of code light the way.

-

This project paints on a 2D canvas, pixel by pixel. I used a custom projection that blends isometric and perspective techniques, to create an uncanny viewpoint between the two. Objects are randomly generated, then an algorithm applies color mixing and position displacement to each pixel as it‚Äôs rendered.

By default the canvas has 2k pixels on its longest edge. You can change this in live view by pressing any number from 1-9. For example, pressing ‚Äò4‚Äô would render it with 4k pixels along the longest edge. I recommend ‚Äò4‚Äô, but this can take up to a few minutes to render.

Press ‚Äòs‚Äô to save the rendered image.
